message.content:
{"id": "2345", "title": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "description": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "OB": "When a user opens a file that is already open in an editor, selecting a different type of editor has no effect. Specifically, when following the steps in 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content, and then selecting test.xml in the Navigator and choosing Open With... / Default Text Editor, nothing happens; it simply reactivates the scripted resource editor example.", "EB": "To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example.
2. Create a new basic project.
3. Create a new file named test.xml.
4. The editor used by default for test.xml is the scripted resource editor example, which ignores the XML file content.
5. Open the Navigator and select test.xml.
6. Right-click on test.xml and choose Open With... / Default Text Editor.
7. Expected behavior: A new editor should open for test.xml because the editor type is different.

NOTES:", "SR": "The bug needs to be fixed so that opening a file that is already open in an editor with a different type of editor correctly opens a new editor for the file."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: ", 'SR': ''}
